TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-silty, mixed, superactive, calcareous, subgelic Fluvaquentic Aquorthels

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Chissovun mucky peat on a woodland terrace with a slope of 2 percent and an elevation of 130 m (The soil was moist throughout when described on September 13, 2015.)
Oe--0 to 11 cm; mucky peat; dark reddish brown (5YR 2.5/2) moist; many very fine roots, and common fine to very coarse roots; very strongly acid (pH 5.0); clear smooth boundary
Oa--11 to 22 cm; muck; black (5YR 2.5/1) moist; common very fine to very coarse roots; strongly acid (pH 5.5); clear irregular boundary
Cg--22 to 38 cm; silt loam; 50 percent gray (2.5Y 6/1) dry, dark gray (2.5Y 4/1) moist, and 50 percent light gray (2.5Y 7/1) dry, gray (2.5Y 5/1) moist; massive; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common very fine and fine roots; few fine and medium pores; 30 percent strong brown (7.5YR 4/6) moist, masses of oxidized iron in matrix; noneffervescent; neutral (pH 7.2); clear wavy boundary
Cg/Oajj--38 to 67 cm; silt loam; 90 percent light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) dry, dark grayish brown (2.5Y 4/2) moist, and 10 percent dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) dry, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; massive; moderately hard, firm, slightly sticky and nonplastic; common fine roots; few fine and medium pores; 10 percent strong brown (7.5YR 4/6) moist, masses of oxidized iron in matrix; slightly effervescent; slightly alkaline (pH 7.5); abrupt wavy boundary
Cgf/Oajjf--67 to 100 cm; silt loam; 90 percent light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) dry, dark grayish brown (2.5Y 4/2) moist, and 10 percent dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) dry, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; massive; hard, very firm, slightly sticky and nonplastic; 7 percent strong brown (7.5YR 4/6) moist, masses of oxidized iron in matrix; slightly effervescent; slightly alkaline (pH 7.6)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Yukon-Koyukuk Census Area, Alaska; latitude 66.2911480 degrees, longitude -146.9064470 degrees, datum WGS84 (coordinates determined with a GPS)

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
Gushdoiman--frequent ponding, tussock tundra vegetation
Goldstream--strongly to very strongly acid mineral horizons
Saulich--pedogenic B horizons; moderately acid to neutral mineral horizons
Strelna--no aquic conditions
Turbellina--strongly acid to extremely acid mineral horizons
Windy Creek--pedogenic B horizons; moderately acid to neutral mineral horizons

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--100 to 300 m
Climate--short, warm summers and long, very cold winters
Mean annual precipitation--210 to 310 mm
Mean annual air temperature-- -12 to 0 degrees C
Frost-free period--45 to 97 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Tlozhavun--no aquic conditions within 150 cm; drier positions on similar landforms
Tajittro--aquic conditions within 100 cm; drier positions on similar landforms
Yanert--aquic conditions within 25 cm; adjacent swales on terraces
Gushdoiman--aquic conditions within 25 cm; wetter positions on similar landforms

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--somewhat poorly drained
Saturation in normal years--water table top depth between a depth of 25 to 50 cm in June, and between a depth of 50 to 75 cm in July and August
Flooding--none
Ponding--occasional, long
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--moderately high or high throughout

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, subsistence
Potential natural vegetation--white spruce, black spruce, resin birch, lingonberry, grayleaf willow, red fruit bearberry, prickly rose, black crowberry, bog blueberry, bog Labrador tea, littletree willow, shrubby cinquefoil, shrub birch, sedge, bluejoint, dwarf scouringrush, felt lichen, greygreen reindeer lichen, cup lichen, stairstep moss

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Yukon Flats Lowlands, Alaska; MLRA 232; moderate extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED: Yukon Flats National Wildlife Refuge, Yukon-Koyukuk Census Area, Alaska; 2017;

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
*Particle-size control section--zone from 47 to 122 cm
*Histic epipedon--Oe and Oa horizons
*Aquic conditions--Cg and Cg/Oajj horizons
*Reduced matrix--Cg, Cg/Oajj, and Cgf/Oajjf horizons
*Redoximorphic iron concentrations--Cg, Cg/Oajj, and Cgf/Oajjf horizons
*Permafrost--Cgf/Oajjf horizon
*Cryoturbation--Cg/Oajj, and Cgf/Oajjf horizons
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
